snippet: The artist Spencer Finch, commissioned by the National September 11 Memorial Museum, has created a skyscape of as many hues as lives lost at ground zero.
abstract: National September 11 Memorial Museum prepares to unveil Spencer Finch's Trying To Remember the Color of the Sky on That September Morning, sole artwork commissioned by museum; piece evokes crystalline sky of the Sept 11 attacks through 2,983 individual squares of paper, each painted a different hue of blue.
lead_paragraph: The artist Spencer Finch, commissioned by the National September 11 Memorial Museum, has created a skyscape of as many hues as lives lost at ground zero.

headline.seo: Spencer Finch Turned to the Heavens to Honor the Dead
headline.main: The Searing Blues of the 9/11 Sky
headline.print_headline: The Searing Blues of the 9/11 Sky
